Published when a customer [custom attribute](entity:CustomAttribute) owned by the
subscribing application is created or updated. Custom attributes are owned by the application that created
the corresponding [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition). Custom attributes whose
`visibility` is `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES` can be created or updated by any application.

This event is replaced by 
[customer.custom_attribute.owned.updated](webhook:customer.custom_attribute.owned.updated).

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

type.description: The type of this event. The value is `"customer.custom_attribute.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event notification.

created_at.description: The timestamp that indicates when the event notification was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

CustomerCustomAttributeUpdatedPublicEven.description:
Published when a customer [custom attribute](entity:CustomAttribute) that is visible
to all applications is created or updated. A notification is sent when any application creates or updates
a custom attribute whose `visibility` is `VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY` or `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES`.

This event is replaced by 
[customer.custom_attribute.visible.updated](webhook:customer.custom_attribute.visible.updated),
which applies to custom attributes that are visible to the subscribing application.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

type.description: The type of this event. The value is `"customer.custom_attribute.public.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event notification.

created_at.description: The timestamp that indicates when the event notification was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

CustomerCustomAttributeVisibleDeletedEve.description:
Published when a customer [custom attribute](entity:CustomAttribute) that is visible to the
subscribing application is deleted. A notification is sent when:
- Your application deletes a custom attribute owned by your application, regardless of the `visibility` setting.
- Any application deletes a custom attribute whose `visibility` is `VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY`
or `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES`.

Custom attributes set to `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES` can be deleted by any application, but those set to
`VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY` or `VISIBILITY_HIDDEN` can only be deleted by the owner. Custom attributes are owned
by the application that created the corresponding [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition).

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

type.description: The type of this event. The value is `"customer.custom_attribute.visible.deleted"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event notification.

created_at.description: The timestamp that indicates when the event notification was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

CustomerCustomAttributeVisibleUpdatedEve.description:
Published when a customer [custom attribute](entity:CustomAttribute) that is visible to the
subscribing application is created or updated. A notification is sent when:
- Your application creates or updates a custom attribute owned by your application, regardless of the `visibility` setting.
- Any application creates or updates a custom attribute whose `visibility` is `VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY`
or `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES`.

Custom attributes set to `VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES` can be created or updated by any application, but those set to
`VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY` or `VISIBILITY_HIDDEN` can only be created or updated by the owner. Custom attributes are owned
by the application that created the corresponding [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition).

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

type.description: The type of this event. The value is `"customer.custom_attribute.visible.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event notification.

created_at.description: The timestamp that indicates when the event notification was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event that triggered the event notification.

CustomerDeletedEvent.description:
Published when a [customer](entity:Customer) is deleted.  For more information, see [Use Customer Webhooks](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/customer-webhooks).

The `customer` object in the event notification does not include the following fields: `group_ids` and `segment_ids`.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event. For this object, the value is `customer.deleted`.

event_id.description: The unique ID of the event, which is used for [idempotency support](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/webhooks/step4manage#webhooks-best-practices).

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event.

CustomerDeletedEventData.description: The data associated with the event.

type.description: The type of object affected by the event. For this event, the value is `customer`.

id.description: The ID of the deleted customer.

object.description: An object that contains the deleted customer.

CustomerDeletedEventEventContext.description: Information about the change that triggered the event.

merge.description: Information about the merge operation associated with the event.

CustomerDeletedEventEventContextMerge.description: Information about a merge operation, which creates a new customer using aggregated properties from two or more existing customers.

from_customer_ids.description: The IDs of the existing customers that were merged and then deleted.

to_customer_id.description: The ID of the new customer created by the merge.

CustomerDeletedEventObject.description: An object that contains the customer associated with the event.

event_context.description: Information about the change that triggered the event. This field is returned only if the customer is deleted by a merge operation.

CustomerDetails.description: Details about the customer making the payment.

customer_initiated.description: Indicates whether the customer initiated the payment.

seller_keyed_in.description:
Indicates that the seller keyed in payment details on behalf of the customer.
This is used to flag a payment as Mail Order / Telephone Order (MOTO).

CustomerFilter.description:
Represents the filtering criteria in a [search query](entity:CustomerQuery) that defines how to filter
customer profiles returned in [SearchCustomers](api-endpoint:Customers-SearchCustomers) results.

creation_source.description: A filter to select customers based on their creation source.

created_at.description: A filter to select customers based on when they were created.

updated_at.description: A filter to select customers based on when they were last updated.

email_address.description:
A filter to [select customers by their email address](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#search-by-email-address) 
visible to the seller. 
This filter is case-insensitive.

For [exact matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#exact-search-by-email-address), this
filter causes the search to return customer profiles 
whose `email_address` field value are identical to the email address provided
in the query.

For [fuzzy matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#fuzzy-search-by-email-address), 
this filter causes the search to return customer profiles 
whose `email_address` field value has a token-wise partial match against the filtering 
expression in the query. For example, with `Steven gmail` provided in a search
query, the search returns customers whose email address is `steven.johnson@gmail.com` 
or `mygmail@stevensbakery.com`. Square removes any punctuation (including periods (.),
underscores (_), and the @ symbol) and tokenizes the email addresses on spaces. A match is
found if a tokenized email address contains all the tokens in the search query, 
irrespective of the token order.

phone_number.description:
A filter to [select customers by their phone numbers](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#search-by-phone-number)
visible to the seller.

For [exact matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#exact-search-by-phone-number),
this filter returns customers whose phone number matches the specified query expression. The number in the query must be of an
E.164-compliant form. In particular, it must include the leading `+` sign followed by a country code and then a subscriber number.
For example, the standard E.164 form of a US phone number is `+12062223333` and an E.164-compliant variation is `+1 (206) 222-3333`.
To match the query expression, stored customer phone numbers are converted to the standard E.164 form.

For [fuzzy matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#fuzzy-search-by-phone-number),
this filter returns customers whose phone number matches the token or tokens provided in the query expression. For example, with `415`
provided in a search query, the search returns customers with the phone numbers `+1-415-212-1200`, `+1-212-415-1234`, and `+1 (551) 234-1567`.
Similarly, a search query of `415 123` returns customers with the phone numbers `+1-212-415-1234` and `+1 (551) 234-1567` but not
`+1-212-415-1200`. A match is found if a tokenized phone number contains all the tokens in the search query, irrespective of the token order.

reference_id.description:
A filter to [select customers by their reference IDs](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#search-by-reference-id).
This filter is case-insensitive.

[Exact matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#exact-search-by-reference-id) 
of a customer's reference ID against a query's reference ID is evaluated as an
exact match between two strings, character by character in the given order.

[Fuzzy matching](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#fuzzy-search-by-reference-id) 
of stored reference IDs against queried reference IDs works 
exactly the same as fuzzy matching on email addresses. Non-alphanumeric characters 
are replaced by spaces to tokenize stored and queried reference IDs. A match is found
if a tokenized stored reference ID contains all tokens specified in any order in the query. For example,
a query of `NYC M` matches customer profiles with the `reference_id` value of `NYC_M_35_JOHNSON`
and `NYC_27_MURRAY`.

group_ids.description:
A filter to select customers based on the [groups](entity:CustomerGroup) they belong to.
Group membership is controlled by sellers and developers.

The `group_ids` filter has the following syntax:
```
"group_ids": {
"any":  ["{group_a_id}", "{group_b_id}", ...],
"all":  ["{group_1_id}", "{group_2_id}", ...],
"none": ["{group_i_id}", "{group_ii_id}", ...]
}
```

You can use any combination of the `any`, `all`, and `none` fields in the filter.
With `any`, the search returns customers in groups `a` or `b` or any other group specified in the list.
With `all`, the search returns customers in groups `1` and `2` and all other groups specified in the list.
With `none`, the search returns customers not in groups `i` or `ii` or any other group specified in the list.

If any of the search conditions are not met, including when an invalid or non-existent group ID is provided,
the result is an empty object (`{}`).

custom_attribute.description:
A filter to select customers based on one or more custom attributes.  
This filter can contain up to 10 custom attribute filters. Each custom attribute filter specifies filtering criteria for a target custom
attribute. If multiple custom attribute filters are provided, they are combined as an `AND` operation.

To be valid for a search, the custom attributes must be visible to the requesting application. For more information, including example queries,
see [Search by custom attribute](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/search-customers#search-by-custom-attribute).

Square returns matching customer profiles, which do not contain custom attributes. To retrieve customer-related custom attributes,
use the [Customer Custom Attributes API](api:CustomerCustomAttributes). For example, you can call
[RetrieveCustomerCustomAttribute](api-endpoint:CustomerCustomAttributes-RetrieveCustomerCustomAttribute) using a customer ID from the result set.

segment_ids.description:
A filter to select customers based on the [segments](entity:CustomerSegment) they belong to.
Segment membership is dynamic and adjusts automatically based on whether customers meet the segment criteria.

You can provide up to three segment IDs in the filter, using any combination of the `all`, `any`, and `none` fields.
For the following example, the results include customers who belong to both segment A and segment B but do not belong to segment C.

```
"segment_ids": {
"all":  ["{segment_A_id}", "{segment_B_id}"],
"none":  ["{segment_C_id}"]
}
```

If an invalid or non-existent segment ID is provided in the filter, Square stops processing the request
and returns a `400 BAD_REQUEST` error that includes the segment ID.

CustomerGroup.description:
Represents a group of customer profiles. 

Customer groups can be created, be modified, and have their membership defined using 
the Customers API or within the Customer Directory in the Square Seller Dashboard or Point of Sale.

id.description: A unique Square-generated ID for the customer group.

name.description: The name of the customer group.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the customer group was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the customer group was last updated, in RFC 3339 format.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be included in the result set when they match the
filtering criteria.

x-enum-elements.name: EXCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be excluded from the result set when they match
the filtering criteria.

CustomerInclusionExclusion.description:
Indicates whether customers should be included in, or excluded from,
the result set when they match the filtering criteria.

CustomerPreferences.description: Represents communication preferences for the customer profile.

email_unsubscribed.description: Indicates whether the customer has unsubscribed from marketing campaign emails. A value of `true` means that the customer chose to opt out of email marketing from the current Square seller or from all Square sellers. This value is read-only from the Customers API.

CustomerQuery.description: Represents filtering and sorting criteria for a [SearchCustomers](api-endpoint:Customers-SearchCustomers) request.

filter.description:
The filtering criteria for the search query. A query can contain multiple filters in any combination.
Multiple filters are combined as `AND` statements.

__Note:__ Combining multiple filters as `OR` statements is not supported. Instead, send multiple single-filter
searches and join the result sets.

sort.description:
Sorting criteria for query results. The default behavior is to sort 
customers alphabetically by `given_name` and `family_name`.

CustomerSegment.description:
Represents a group of customer profiles that match one or more predefined filter criteria. 

Segments (also known as Smart Groups) are defined and created within the Customer Directory in the
Square Seller Dashboard or Point of Sale.

id.description: A unique Square-generated ID for the segment.

name.description: The name of the segment.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the segment was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the segment was last updated, in RFC 3339 format.

CustomerSort.description:
Represents the sorting criteria in a [search query](entity:CustomerQuery) that defines how to sort
customer profiles returned in [SearchCustomers](api-endpoint:Customers-SearchCustomers) results.

field.description:
Indicates the fields to use as the sort key, which is either the default set of fields or `created_at`.

The default value is `DEFAULT`.
See [CustomerSortField](#type-customersortfield) for possible values

order.description:
Indicates the order in which results should be sorted based on the
sort field value. Strings use standard alphabetic comparison
to determine order. Strings representing numbers are sorted as strings.

The default value is `ASC`.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: DEFAULT
x-enum-elements.description:
Use the default sort key. By default, customers are sorted
alphanumerically by concatenating their `given_name` and `family_name`. If
neither name field is set, string comparison is performed using one of the
remaining fields in the following order: `company_name`, `email`,
`phone_number`.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: Use the creation date attribute (`created_at`) of customer profiles as the sort key.

CustomerSortField.description: Specifies customer attributes as the sort key to customer profiles returned from a search.

CustomerTaxIds.description:
Represents the tax ID associated with a [customer profile](entity:Customer). The corresponding `tax_ids` field is available only for customers of sellers in EU countries or the United Kingdom. 
For more information, see [Customer tax IDs](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/what-it-does#customer-tax-ids).

eu_vat.description: The EU VAT identification number for the customer. For example, `IE3426675K`. The ID can contain alphanumeric characters only.

CustomerTextFilter.description:
A filter to select customers based on exact or fuzzy matching of
customer attributes against a specified query. Depending on the customer attributes, 
the filter can be case-sensitive. This filter can be exact or fuzzy, but it cannot be both.

exact.description: Use the exact filter to select customers whose attributes match exactly the specified query.

fuzzy.description:
Use the fuzzy filter to select customers whose attributes match the specified query 
in a fuzzy manner. When the fuzzy option is used, search queries are tokenized, and then 
each query token must be matched somewhere in the searched attribute. For single token queries, 
this is effectively the same behavior as a partial match operation.

CustomerUpdatedEvent.description:
Published when a [customer](entity:Customer) is updated. For more information, see [Use Customer Webhooks](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/customer-webhooks).

Updates to the 'segment_ids' customer field does not invoke a `customer.updated` event. In addition, the `customer` object in the event notification does not include this field.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event. For this object, the value is `customer.updated`.

event_id.description: The unique ID of the event, which is used for [idempotency support](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/webhooks/step4manage#webhooks-best-practices).

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: The data associated with the event.

CustomerUpdatedEventData.description: The data associated with the event.

type.description: The type of object affected by the event. For this event, the value is `customer`.

id.description: The ID of the updated customer.

object.description: An object that contains the updated customer.

CustomerUpdatedEventObject.description: An object that contains the customer associated with the event.

end_date.description:
A string in `YYYY-MM-DD` format, such as `2017-10-31`, per the ISO 8601
extended format for calendar dates.
The end of a date range (inclusive).

Destination.description: Information about the destination against which the payout was made.

type.description:
Type of the destination such as a bank account or debit card.
See [DestinationType](#type-destinationtype) for possible values

id.description: Square issued unique ID (also known as the instrument ID) associated with this destination.

card_details.description: Details about a card refund. Only populated if the destination_type is `CARD`.

cash_details.description: Details about a cash refund. Only populated if the destination_type is `CASH`.

external_details.description: Details about an external refund. Only populated if the destination_type is `EXTERNAL`.

entry_method.description:
The method used to enter the card's details for the refund. The method can be
`KEYED`, `SWIPED`, `EMV`, `ON_FILE`, or `CONTACTLESS`.

auth_result_code.description: The authorization code provided by the issuer when a refund is approved.

DestinationDetailsCashRefundDetails.description: Stores details about a cash refund. Contains only non-confidential information.

seller_supplied_money.description: The amount and currency of the money supplied by the seller.

change_back_money.description:
The amount of change due back to the seller.
This read-only field is calculated
from the `amount_money` and `seller_supplied_money` fields.

DestinationDetailsExternalRefundDetails.description: Stores details about an external refund. Contains only non-confidential information.

type.description:
The type of external refund the seller paid to the buyer. It can be one of the
following:
- CHECK - Refunded using a physical check.
- BANK_TRANSFER - Refunded using external bank transfer.
- OTHER\_GIFT\_CARD - Refunded using a non-Square gift card.
- CRYPTO - Refunded using a crypto currency.
- SQUARE_CASH - Refunded using Square Cash App.
- SOCIAL - Refunded using peer-to-peer payment applications.
- EXTERNAL - A third-party application gathered this refund outside of Square.
- EMONEY - Refunded using an E-money provider.
- CARD - A credit or debit card that Square does not support.
- STORED_BALANCE - Use for house accounts, store credit, and so forth.
- FOOD_VOUCHER - Restaurant voucher provided by employers to employees to pay for meals
- OTHER - A type not listed here.

source.description:
A description of the external refund source. For example,
"Food Delivery Service".

source_id.description: An ID to associate the refund to its originating source.

x-enum-elements.name: BANK_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: An external bank account outside of Square.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD
x-enum-elements.description: An external card outside of Square used for the transfer.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE_STORED_BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description: Square Checking or Savings account (US), Square Card (CA)

DestinationType.description: List of possible destinations against which a payout can be made.

id.description:
A synthetic identifier for the device. The identifier includes a standardized prefix and
is otherwise an opaque id generated from key device fields.

attributes.description: A collection of DeviceAttributes representing the device.

components.description: A list of components applicable to the device.

status.description: The current status of the device.

type.description:
The device type.
See [DeviceType](#type-devicetype) for possible values

model.description: The specific model of the device.

name.description: A seller-specified name for the device.

manufacturers_id.description:
The manufacturer-supplied identifier for the device (where available). In many cases,
this identifier will be a serial number.

updated_at.description:
The RFC 3339-formatted value of the most recent update to the device information.
(Could represent any field update on the device.)

version.description: The current version of software installed on the device.

merchant_token.description: The merchant_token identifying the merchant controlling the device.

device_id.description:
The unique ID of the device intended for this `TerminalCheckout`.
A list of `DeviceCode` objects can be retrieved from the /v2/devices/codes endpoint.
Match a `DeviceCode.device_id` value with `device_id` to get the associated device code.

skip_receipt_screen.description: Instructs the device to skip the receipt screen. Defaults to false.

collect_signature.description: Indicates that signature collection is desired during checkout. Defaults to false.

show_itemized_cart.description:
Show the itemization screen prior to taking a payment. This field is only meaningful when the
checkout includes an order ID. Defaults to true.

name.description: An optional user-defined name for the device code.

code.description: The unique code that can be used to login.

The pairing status of the device code.

status_changed_at.description: When this DeviceCode's status was last changed. Timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

paired_at.description: When this DeviceCode was paired. Timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_EVIDENCE
x-enum-elements.description:
Square assumes this evidence type if you do not provide a type when uploading evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_OR_APP_ACCESS_LOG
x-enum-elements.description:
Server or activity logs that show proof of the cardholder’s identity and that the
cardholder successfully ordered and received the goods (digitally or otherwise).
Example evidence includes IP addresses, corresponding timestamps/dates, cardholder’s name and email
address linked to a cardholder profile held by the seller, proof the same device and card (used
in dispute) were previously used in prior undisputed transaction, and any related detailed activity.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZATION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder did provide authorization for the charge.
Example evidence includes a signed credit card authorization.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLATION_OR_REFUND_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder acknowledged your refund or cancellation policy.
Example evidence includes a signature or checkbox showing the cardholder’s acknowledgement of your
refund or cancellation policy.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_COMMUNICATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows relevant communication with the cardholder.
Example evidence includes emails or texts that show the cardholder received goods/services or
demonstrate cardholder satisfaction.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INFORMATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that validates the customer's identity.
Example evidence includes personally identifiable details such as name, email address, purchaser IP
address, and a copy of the cardholder ID.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: PURCHASE_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows proof of the sale/transaction.
Example evidence includes an invoice, contract, or other item showing the customer’s acknowledgement
of the purchase and your terms.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE_CHARGE_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the charges in question are valid and distinct from one another.
Example evidence includes receipts, shipping labels, and invoices along with their distinct payment IDs.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: PRODUCT_OR_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION
x-enum-elements.description:
A description of the product or service sold.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIPT
x-enum-elements.description:
A receipt or message sent to the cardholder detailing the charge.
Note: You do not need to upload the Square receipt; Square submits the receipt on your behalf.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: SERVICE_RECEIVED_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the service was provided to the cardholder or the expected date that services will be rendered.
Example evidence includes a signed delivery form, work order, expected delivery date, or other written agreements.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: PROOF_OF_DELIVERY_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the product was provided to the cardholder or the expected date of delivery.
Example evidence includes a signed delivery form or written agreement acknowledging receipt of the goods or services.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: RELATED_TRANSACTION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the cardholder previously processed transactions on the same card and did not dispute them.
Note: Square automatically provides up to five distinct Square receipts for related transactions, when available.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: REBUTTAL_EXPLANATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An explanation of why the cardholder’s claim is invalid.
Example evidence includes an explanation of why each distinct charge is a legitimate purchase, why the cardholder’s claim
for credit owed due to their attempt to cancel, return, or refund is invalid per your stated policy and cardholder
agreement, or an explanation of how the cardholder did not attempt to remedy the issue with you first to receive credit.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: TRACKING_NUMBER
x-enum-elements.description:
The tracking number for the order provided by the shipping carrier. If you have multiple numbers, they need to be
submitted individually as separate pieces of evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as a string.

DisputeEvidenceType.description: The type of the dispute evidence.

x-enum-elements.name: AMOUNT_DIFFERS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged the wrong amount for the purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that the cardholder agreed
to the amount charged.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they attempted to return the goods or cancel the service.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder
is not due a refund and that the cardholder acknowledged your cancellation policy.

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged twice for the same purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are
legitimate and independent of one another.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_KNOWLEDGE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they did not make this purchase nor authorized the charge.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that proves that the cardholder
identity was verified at the time of purchase and that the purchase was authorized.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_AS_DESCRIBED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was provided, but the quality of the deliverable
did not align with the expectations of the cardholder based on the description.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows the cardholder is in
possession of the product as described or received the service as described and agreed on.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_RECEIVED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was not received by the cardholder within the
stated time frame.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is
in possession of or received the product or service sold.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID_BY_OTHER_MEANS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they previously paid for this purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are
legitimate and independent of one another or proof that you already provided a credit for the charge.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_REQUESTS_CREDIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that the purchase was canceled or returned, but they have not yet received
the credit.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is not
due a refund and that they acknowledged your cancellation and/or refund policy.

x-enum-elements.name: EMV_LIABILITY_SHIFT
x-enum-elements.description:
A chip-enabled card was not processed through a compliant chip-card reader (for example, it was swiped
instead of dipped into a chip-card reader).
You cannot challenge this dispute because the payment did not comply with EMV security requirements.
For more information, see [What Is EMV?](https://squareup.com/emv)

DisputeReason.description:
The list of possible reasons why a cardholder might initiate a
dispute with their bank.

x-enum-elements.name: INQUIRY_EVIDENCE_REQUIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The initial state of an inquiry with evidence required

x-enum-elements.name: INQUIRY_PROCESSING
x-enum-elements.description: Inquiry evidence has been submitted and the bank is processing the inquiry

x-enum-elements.name: INQUIRY_CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The inquiry is complete

x-enum-elements.name: EVIDENCE_REQUIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The initial state of a dispute with evidence required

x-enum-elements.name: PROCESSING
x-enum-elements.description: Dispute evidence has been submitted and the bank is processing the dispute

x-enum-elements.name: WON
x-enum-elements.description: The bank has completed processing the dispute and the seller has won

x-enum-elements.name: LOST
x-enum-elements.description: The bank has completed processing the dispute and the seller has lost

x-enum-elements.name: ACCEPTED
x-enum-elements.description: The seller has accepted the dispute

DisputeState.description: The list of possible dispute states.

DisputeStateChangedEvent.description:
Published when the state of a [Dispute](entity:Dispute) changes.
This includes the dispute resolution (WON, LOST) reported by the bank. The event
data includes details of what changed.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

location_id.description: The ID of the target location associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected dispute's type.

id.description: ID of the affected dispute.

object.description: An object containing fields and values relevant to the event.
The dispute object.

DisputeStateUpdatedEvent.description:
Published when the state of a [Dispute](entity:Dispute) changes.
This includes the dispute resolution (WON, LOST) reported by the bank. The event
data includes details of what changed.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

location_id.description: The ID of the target location associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected dispute's type.

id.description: ID of the affected dispute.

object.description: An object containing fields and values relevant to the event.
The dispute object.

payment_id.description: Square-generated unique ID of the payment being disputed.

x-enum-elements.name: UNINDEXED
x-enum-elements.description: Item is not synced with Ecom (Weebly). This is the default state

x-enum-elements.name: UNAVAILABLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but is unavailable within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout

x-enum-elements.name: HIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose manually created Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIBLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but available within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout but is hidden from Ecom Store.

EcomVisibility.description: Determines item visibility in Ecom (Online Store) and Online Checkout.

Employee.description:
An employee object that is used by the external API.

DEPRECATED at version 2020-08-26. Replaced by [TeamMember](entity:TeamMember).

id.description: UUID for this object.

phone_number.description: The employee's phone number in E.164 format, i.e. "+12125554250"

location_ids.description: A list of location IDs where this employee has access to.

status.description:
Specifies the status of the employees being fetched.
See [EmployeeStatus](#type-employeestatus) for possible values

is_owner.description:
Whether this employee is the owner of the merchant. Each merchant
has one owner employee, and that employee has full authority over
the account.

created_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Active state.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Inactive state.

EmployeeStatus.description:
The status of the Employee being retrieved.

DEPRECATED at version 2020-08-26. Replaced by [TeamMemberStatus](entity:TeamMemberStatus).

EmployeeWage.description: The hourly wage rate that an employee earns on a `Shift` for doing the job specified by the `title` property of this object. Deprecated at version 2020-08-26. Use [TeamMemberWage](entity:TeamMemberWage).

id.description: The UUID for this object.

employee_id.description: The `Employee` that this wage is assigned to.

title.description: The job title that this wage relates to.

hourly_rate.description:
Can be a custom-set hourly wage or the calculated effective hourly
wage based on the annual wage and hours worked per week.

EnableEventsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [EnableEvents](api-endpoint:Events-EnableEvents) endpoint.

Note: if there are errors processing the request, the events field will not be
present.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.

Error.description:
Represents an error encountered during a request to the Connect API.

See [Handling errors](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/handling-errors) for more information.

category.description:
The high-level category for the error.
See [ErrorCategory](#type-errorcategory) for possible values

code.description:
The specific code of the error.
See [ErrorCode](#type-errorcode) for possible values

detail.description: A human-readable description of the error for debugging purposes.

field.description:
The name of the field provided in the original request (if any) that
the error pertains to.

x-enum-elements.name: API_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred with the Connect API itself.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An authentication error occurred. Most commonly, the request had
a missing, malformed, or otherwise invalid `Authorization` header.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_REQUEST_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
The request was invalid. Most commonly, a required parameter was
missing, or a provided parameter had an invalid value.

x-enum-elements.name: RATE_LIMIT_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
Your application reached the Square API rate limit. You might receive this error if your application sends a high number of requests
to Square APIs in a short period of time.

Your application should monitor responses for `429 RATE_LIMITED` errors and use a retry mechanism with an [exponential backoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exponential_backoff)
schedule to resend the requests at an increasingly slower rate. It is also a good practice to use a randomized delay (jitter) in your retry schedule.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An error occurred while processing a payment method. Most commonly,
the details of the payment method were invalid (such as a card's CVV
or expiration date).

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred while attempting to process a refund.

x-enum-elements.name: MERCHANT_SUBSCRIPTION_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred when checking a merchant subscription status

x-enum-elements.name: EXTERNAL_VENDOR_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error that is returned from an external vendor's API

ErrorCategory.description:
Indicates which high-level category of error has occurred during a
request to the Connect API.

x-enum-elements.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: A general server error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: UNAUTHORIZED
x-enum-elements.description: A general authorization error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided access token has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_REVOKED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided access token has been revoked.

x-enum-elements.name: CLIENT_DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided client has been disabled.

x-enum-elements.name: FORBIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: A general access error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_SCOPES
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided access token does not have permission
to execute the requested action.

x-enum-elements.name: APPLICATION_DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: The calling application was disabled.

x-enum-elements.name: V1_APPLICATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The calling application was created prior to
2016-03-30 and is not compatible with v2 Square API calls.

x-enum-elements.name: V1_ACCESS_TOKEN
x-enum-elements.description:
The calling application is using an access token
created prior to 2016-03-30 and is not compatible with v2 Square API
calls.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_PROCESSING_NOT_ENABLED
x-enum-elements.description:
The location provided in the API call is not
enabled for credit card processing.

x-enum-elements.name: MERCHANT_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND
x-enum-elements.description: A required subscription was not found for the merchant

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_REQUEST
x-enum-elements.description: A general error occurred with the request.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAMETER
x-enum-elements.description:
The request is missing a required path, query, or
body parameter.

x-enum-elements.name: INCORRECT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description:
The value provided in the request is the wrong
type. For example, a string instead of an integer.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME
x-enum-elements.description:
Formatting for the provided time value is
incorrect.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME_RANGE
x-enum-elements.description:
The time range provided in the request is invalid.
For example, the end time is before the start time.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided value is invalid. For example,
including `%` in a phone number.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CURSOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The pagination cursor included in the request is
invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_QUERY_PARAMETER
x-enum-elements.description:
The query parameters provided is invalid for the
requested endpoint.

x-enum-elements.name: CONFLICTING_PARAMETERS
x-enum-elements.description:
One or more of the request parameters conflict with
each other.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_JSON_BODY
x-enum-elements.description: The request body is not a JSON object.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_SORT_ORDER
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided sort order is not a valid key.
Currently, sort order must be `ASC` or `DESC`.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_REGEX_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided value does not match an expected
regular expression.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided string value is shorter than the
minimum length allowed.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided string value is longer than the
maximum length allowed.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_LOW
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided value is less than the supported
minimum.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_HIGH
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided value is greater than the supported
maximum.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_EMPTY
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided value has a default (empty) value
such as a blank string.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description: The provided array has too many elements.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description: The provided array has too few elements.

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_EMPTY
x-enum-elements.description: The provided array is empty.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BOOLEAN
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be a
boolean.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_INTEGER
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be an
integer.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_FLOAT
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be a
float.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_STRING
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be a
string.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_OBJECT
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be a
JSON object.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_ARRAY
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be an
array or list.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_MAP
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be a
map or associative array.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BASE64_ENCODED_BYTE_ARRAY
x-enum-elements.description:
The endpoint expected the provided value to be an
array encoded in base64.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ARRAY_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
One or more objects in the array does not match the
array type.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENUM_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
The provided static string is not valid for the
field.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: Invalid content type header.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FORM_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description:
Only relevant for applications created prior to
2016-03-30. Indicates there was an error while parsing form values.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_NOT_FOUND
x-enum-elements.description: The provided customer id can't be found in the merchant's customers list.

x-enum-elements.name: ONE_INSTRUMENT_EXPECTED
x-enum-elements.description: A general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_FIELDS_SET
x-enum-elements.description: A general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: TOO_MANY_MAP_ENTRIES
x-enum-elements.description: Too many entries in the map field.

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT
x-enum-elements.description: The length of one of the provided keys in the map is too short.

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description: The length of one of the provided keys in the map is too long.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_MISSING_NAME
x-enum-elements.description: The provided customer does not have a recorded name.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_MISSING_EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description: The provided customer does not have a recorded email.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_PAUSE_LENGTH
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription cannot be paused longer than the duration of the current phase.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_DATE
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription cannot be paused/resumed on the given date.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_COUNTRY
x-enum-elements.description: The API request references an unsupported country.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_CURRENCY
x-enum-elements.description: The API request references an unsupported currency.

x-enum-elements.name: APPLE_TTP_PIN_TOKEN
x-enum-elements.description:
The payment was declined by the card issuer during an Apple Tap to Pay (TTP)
transaction with a request for the card's PIN. This code will be returned alongside
`CARD_DECLINED_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED` as a supplemental error, and will include an
issuer-provided token in the `details` field that is needed to initiate the PIN
collection flow on the iOS device.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a date in the past.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_YEAR
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration year for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a year in the past or contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_CARD_BRAND
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card provided is not from a supported issuer.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_ENTRY_METHOD
x-enum-elements.description: The entry method for the credit card (swipe, dip, tap) is not supported.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENCRYPTED_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The encrypted card information is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card cannot be validated based on the provided details.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_AMOUNT_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
The payment was declined because there was a payment amount mismatch.
The money amount Square was expecting does not match the amount provided.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_DECLINE
x-enum-elements.description:
Square received a decline without any additional information.
If the payment information seems correct, the buyer can contact their
issuer to ask for more information.

x-enum-elements.name: CVV_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the CVV value is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDRESS_VERIFICATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the postal code is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The issuer was not able to locate the account on record.

x-enum-elements.name: CURRENCY_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
The currency associated with the payment is not valid for the provided
funding source. For example, a gift card funded in USD cannot be used to process
payments in GBP.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
x-enum-elements.description: The funding source has insufficient funds to cover the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account does not have the permissions to accept
this payment. For example, Square may limit which merchants are
allowed to receive gift card payments.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has declined the transaction due to restrictions on where the card can be used.
For example, a gift card is limited to a single merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account cannot take payments in the specified region.
A Square account can take payments only from the region where the account was created.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSACTION_LIMIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has determined the payment amount is either too high or too low.
The API returns the error code mostly for credit cards (for example, the card reached
the credit limit). However, sometimes the issuer bank can indicate the error for debit
or prepaid cards (for example, card has insufficient funds).

x-enum-elements.name: VOICE_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the issuer requires voice authorization from the cardholder. The seller should ask the customer to contact the card issuing bank to authorize the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: PAN_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The specified card number is invalid. For example, it is of
incorrect length or is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The card expiration date is either invalid or indicates that the
card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description:
The card is not supported either in the geographic region or by
the [merchant category code](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/locations-api#initialize-a-merchant-category-code) (MCC).

x-enum-elements.name: READER_DECLINED
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Card Reader declined the payment for an unknown reason.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_PIN
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the PIN is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_PIN
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is missing a required PIN.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_ACCOUNT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is missing a required ACCOUNT_TYPE parameter.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_POSTAL_CODE
x-enum-elements.description: The postal code is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FEES
x-enum-elements.description: The app_fee_money on a payment is too high.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUALLY_ENTERED_PAYMENT_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description: The card must be swiped, tapped, or dipped. Payments attempted by manually entering the card number are declined.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
x-enum-elements.description: Square declined the request because the payment amount exceeded the processing limit for this merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
When a Gift Card is a payment source, you can allow taking a partial payment
by adding the `accept_partial_authorization` parameter in the request.
However, taking such a partial payment does not work if your request also includes
`tip_money`, `app_fee_money`, or both. Square declines such payments and returns
the `GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT` error.
For more information, see
[CreatePayment errors (additional information)](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/payments-api/error-codes#createpayment-errors-additional-information).

x-enum-elements.name: ACCOUNT_UNUSABLE
x-enum-elements.description: The account provided cannot carry out transactions.

x-enum-elements.name: BUYER_REFUSED_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Bank account rejected or was not authorized for the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to update a delayed-capture payment that has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to cancel a delayed-capture payment that was already cancelled.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_CAPTURED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to capture a delayed-capture payment that was already captured.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to update a delayed-capture payment that failed.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_TOKEN_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided card token (nonce) has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_TOKEN_USED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided card token (nonce) was already used to process the payment or refund.

x-enum-elements.name: AMOUNT_TOO_HIGH
x-enum-elements.description: The requested payment amount is too high for the provided payment source.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_INSTRUMENT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: The API request references an unsupported instrument type.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_AMOUNT_INVALID
x-enum-elements.description: The requested refund amount exceeds the amount available to refund.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ALREADY_PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The payment already has a pending refund.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_NOT_REFUNDABLE
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is not refundable. For example, the payment is too old to be refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_NOT_REFUNDABLE_DUE_TO_DISPUTE
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is not refundable because it has been disputed.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ERROR_PAYMENT_NEEDS_COMPLETION
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is not refundable because the payment is approved and needs to be completed first before the refund is issued.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_DECLINED
