SearchSubscriptionsFilter.description:
Represents a set of query expressions (filters) to narrow the scope of targeted subscriptions returned by 
the [SearchSubscriptions](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SearchSubscriptions) endpoint.

customer_ids.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the subscribing customer IDs.

location_ids.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the location.

source_names.description: A filter to select subscriptions based on the source application.

SearchSubscriptionsQuery.description: Represents a query, consisting of specified query expressions, used to search for subscriptions.

SearchSubscriptionsRequest.description:
Defines input parameters in a request to the 
[SearchSubscriptions](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SearchSubscriptions) endpoint.

cursor.description:
When the total number of resulting subscriptions exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
specify the cursor returned from a preceding response here to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

limit.description:
The upper limit on the number of subscriptions to return
in a paged response.

query.description:
A subscription query consisting of specified filtering conditions.

If this `query` field is unspecified, the `SearchSubscriptions` call will return all subscriptions.

include.description:
An option to include related information in the response. 

The supported values are: 

- `actions`: to include scheduled actions on the targeted subscriptions.

SearchSubscriptionsResponse.description:
Defines output parameters in a response from the
[SearchSubscriptions](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SearchSubscriptions) endpoint.

errors.description: Errors encountered during the request.

subscriptions.description: The subscriptions matching the specified query expressions.

cursor.description:
When the total number of resulting subscription exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
the response includes a cursor for you to use in a subsequent request to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

SearchTeamMembersFilter.description:
Represents a filter used in a search for `TeamMember` objects. `AND` logic is applied
between the individual fields, and `OR` logic is applied within list-based fields.
For example, setting this filter value:
```
filter = (locations_ids = ["A", "B"], status = ACTIVE)
```
returns only active team members assigned to either location "A" or "B".

location_ids.description:
When present, filters by team members assigned to the specified locations.
When empty, includes team members assigned to any location.

status.description:
When present, filters by team members who match the given status.
When empty, includes team members of all statuses.
See [TeamMemberStatus](#type-teammemberstatus) for possible values

is_owner.description: When present and set to true, returns the team member who is the owner of the Square account.

SearchTeamMembersQuery.description: Represents the parameters in a search for `TeamMember` objects.

SearchTeamMembersRequest.description: Represents a search request for a filtered list of `TeamMember` objects.

limit.description: The maximum number of `TeamMember` objects in a page (100 by default).

cursor.description:
The opaque cursor for fetching the next page. For more information, see
[pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

SearchTeamMembersResponse.description: Represents a response from a search request containing a filtered list of `TeamMember` objects.

cursor.description:
The opaque cursor for fetching the next page. For more information, see
[pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

errors.description: The errors that occurred during the request.

query.description:
Queries terminal actions based on given conditions and sort order.
Leaving this unset will return all actions with the default sort order.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.
See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more
information.

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned for a single request.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If empty,
this is the final response.

See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more
information.

query.description:
Queries Terminal checkouts based on given conditions and the sort order.
Leaving these unset returns all checkouts with the default sort order.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this cursor to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.
See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more information.

limit.description: Limits the number of results returned for a single request.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

checkouts.description: The requested search result of `TerminalCheckout` objects.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If empty,
this is the final response.

See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more information.

query.description:
Queries the Terminal refunds based on given conditions and the sort order. Calling
`SearchTerminalRefunds` without an explicit query parameter returns all available
refunds with the default sort order.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this cursor to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.

limit.description: Limits the number of results returned for a single request.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

refunds.description: The requested search result of `TerminalRefund` objects.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If empty,
this is the final response.

See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more information.

SearchTimecardsRequest.description: A request for a filtered and sorted set of `Timecard` objects.

limit.description: The number of resources in a page (200 by default).

cursor.description: An opaque cursor for fetching the next page.

SearchTimecardsResponse.description:
The response to a request for `Timecard` objects. The response contains
the requested `Timecard` objects and might contain a set of `Error` objects if
the request resulted in errors.

cursor.description: An opaque cursor for fetching the next page.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

SearchVendorsRequest.description: Represents an input into a call to [SearchVendors](api-endpoint:Vendors-SearchVendors).

filter.description: Specifies a filter used to search for vendors.

sort.description: Specifies a sorter used to sort the returned vendors.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

SearchVendorsRequestFilter.description: Defines supported query expressions to search for vendors by.

name.description: The names of the [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects to retrieve.

status.description:
The statuses of the [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects to retrieve.
See [VendorStatus](#type-vendorstatus) for possible values

SearchVendorsRequestSort.description: Defines a sorter used to sort results from [SearchVendors](api-endpoint:Vendors-SearchVendors).

field.description:
Specifies the sort key to sort the returned vendors.
See [Field](#type-field) for possible values

order.description:
Specifies the sort order for the returned vendors.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: NAME
x-enum-elements.description: To sort the result by the name of the [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: To sort the result by the creation time of the [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects.

SearchVendorsRequestSortField.description: The field to sort the returned [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects by.

SearchVendorsResponse.description: Represents an output from a call to [SearchVendors](api-endpoint:Vendors-SearchVendors).

errors.description: Errors encountered when the request fails.

vendors.description: The [Vendor](entity:Vendor) objects matching the specified search filter.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If unset,
this is the final response.

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

SegmentFilter.description: A query filter to search for buyer-accessible appointment segments by.

service_variation_id.description: The ID of the [CatalogItemVariation](entity:CatalogItemVariation) object representing the service booked in this segment.

team_member_id_filter.description:
A query filter to search for buyer-accessible appointment segments with service-providing team members matching the specified list of team member IDs.  Supported query expressions are
- `ANY`: return the appointment segments with team members whose IDs match any member in this list.
- `NONE`: return the appointment segments with team members whose IDs are not in this list.
- `ALL`: not supported.

When no expression is specified, any service-providing team member is eligible to fulfill the Booking.

reference_id.description: The reference id for the option.

title.description: The title text that displays in the select option button.
The title text to display in the select flow on the Terminal.

body.description: The body text to display in the select flow on the Terminal.

options.description: Represents the buttons/options that should be displayed in the select flow on the Terminal.

Shift.description:
A record of the hourly rate, start, and end times for a single work shift
for an employee. This might include a record of the start and end times for breaks
taken during the shift.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. Replaced by [Timecard](entity:Timecard).
See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

id.description: The UUID for this object.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee this shift belongs to. DEPRECATED at version 2020-08-26. Use `team_member_id` instead.

location_id.description:
The ID of the location this shift occurred at. The location should be based on
where the employee clocked in.

timezone.description:
The read-only convenience value that is calculated from the location based
on the `location_id`. Format: the IANA timezone database identifier for the
location timezone.

start_at.description:
RFC 3339; shifted to the location timezone + offset. Precision up to the
minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

end_at.description:
RFC 3339; shifted to the timezone + offset. Precision up to the minute is
respected; seconds are truncated.

wage.description:
Job and pay related information. If the wage is not set on create, it defaults to a wage
of zero. If the title is not set on create, it defaults to the name of the role the employee
is assigned to, if any.

breaks.description: A list of all the paid or unpaid breaks that were taken during this shift.

status.description:
Describes the working state of the current `Shift`.
See [ShiftStatus](#type-shiftstatus) for possible values

version.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version
provided does not match the server version at the time of the request. If not provided,
Square executes a blind write; potentially overwriting data from another
write.

created_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format; presented in UTC.

updated_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format; presented in UTC.

team_member_id.description: The ID of the team member this shift belongs to. Replaced `employee_id` at version "2020-08-26".

declared_cash_tip_money.description: The tips declared by the team member for the shift.

ShiftFilter.description:
Defines a filter used in a search for `Shift` records. `AND` logic is
used by Square's servers to apply each filter property specified.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

location_ids.description: Fetch shifts for the specified location.

employee_ids.description: Fetch shifts for the specified employees. DEPRECATED at version 2020-08-26. Use `team_member_ids` instead.

status.description:
Fetch a `Shift` instance by `Shift.status`.
See [ShiftFilterStatus](#type-shiftfilterstatus) for possible values

start.description: Fetch `Shift` instances that start in the time range - Inclusive.

end.description: Fetch the `Shift` instances that end in the time range - Inclusive.

workday.description: Fetch the `Shift` instances based on the workday date range.

team_member_ids.description: Fetch shifts for the specified team members. Replaced `employee_ids` at version "2020-08-26".

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: Shifts that have been started and not ended.

x-enum-elements.name: CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description: Shifts that have been started and ended.

ShiftFilterStatus.description:
Specifies the `status` of `Shift` records to be returned.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

ShiftQuery.description:
The parameters of a `Shift` search query, which includes filter and sort options.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

ShiftSort.description:
Sets the sort order of search results.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

field.description:
The field to sort on.
See [ShiftSortField](#type-shiftsortfield) for possible values

order.description:
The order in which results are returned. Defaults to DESC.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: START_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The start date/time of a `Shift`

x-enum-elements.name: END_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The end date/time of a `Shift`

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The date/time that a `Shift` is created

x-enum-elements.name: UPDATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The most recent date/time that a `Shift` is updated

ShiftSortField.description:
Enumerates the `Shift` fields to sort on.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: Employee started a work shift and the shift is not complete

x-enum-elements.name: CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description: Employee started and ended a work shift.

ShiftStatus.description:
Enumerates the possible status of a `Shift`.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

ShiftWage.description:
The hourly wage rate used to compensate an employee for this shift.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

title.description: The name of the job performed during this shift.

hourly_rate.description:
Can be a custom-set hourly wage or the calculated effective hourly
wage based on the annual wage and hours worked per week.

job_id.description:
The id of the job performed during this shift. Square
labor-reporting UIs might group shifts together by id.

tip_eligible.description: Whether team members are eligible for tips when working this job.

ShiftWorkday.description:
A `Shift` search query filter parameter that sets a range of days that
a `Shift` must start or end in before passing the filter condition.

Deprecated at Square API version 2025-05-21. See the [migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/labor-api/what-it-does#migration-notes).

match_shifts_by.description:
The strategy on which the dates are applied.
See [ShiftWorkdayMatcher](#type-shiftworkdaymatcher) for possible values

default_timezone.description:
Location-specific timezones convert workdays to datetime filters.
Every location included in the query must have a timezone or this field
must be provided as a fallback. Format: the IANA timezone database
identifier for the relevant timezone.

x-enum-elements.name: START_AT
x-enum-elements.description: All shifts that start on or after the specified workday

x-enum-elements.name: END_AT
x-enum-elements.description: All shifts that end on or before the specified workday

x-enum-elements.name: INTERSECTION
x-enum-elements.description: All shifts that start between the start and end workdays (inclusive)

ShiftWorkdayMatcher.description: Defines the logic used to apply a workday filter.

name.description: The name for the shipping fee.

charge.description: The amount and currency for the shipping fee.

image_type.description:
The mime/type of the image data.
Use `image/png;base64` for png.

data.description: The base64 representation of the image.

title.description: The title text to display in the signature capture flow on the Terminal.

body.description: The body text to display in the signature capture flow on the Terminal.

signature.description: An image representation of the collected signature.

Site.description: Represents a Square Online site, which is an online store for a Square seller.

id.description: The Square-assigned ID of the site.

domain.description: The domain of the site (without the protocol). For example, `mysite1.square.site`.

is_published.description: Indicates whether the site is published.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the site was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the site was last updated, in RFC 3339 format.

Snippet.description: Represents the snippet that is added to a Square Online site. The snippet code is injected into the `head` element of all pages on the site, except for checkout pages.

id.description: The Square-assigned ID for the snippet.

site_id.description: The ID of the site that contains the snippet.

content.description: The snippet code, which can contain valid HTML, JavaScript, or both.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the snippet was initially added to the site, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the snippet was last updated on the site, in RFC 3339 format.

x-enum-elements.name: DESC
x-enum-elements.description: The results are returned in descending (e.g., newest-first or Z-A) order.

x-enum-elements.name: ASC
x-enum-elements.description: The results are returned in ascending (e.g., oldest-first or A-Z) order.

SortOrder.description: The order (e.g., chronological or alphabetical) in which results from a request are returned.

SourceApplication.description: Represents information about the application used to generate a change.

product.description:
__Read only__ The [product](entity:Product) type of the application.
See [Product](#type-product) for possible values

application_id.description:
__Read only__ The Square-assigned ID of the application. This field is used only if the
[product](entity:Product) type is `EXTERNAL_API`.

name.description:
__Read only__ The display name of the application
(for example, `"Custom Application"` or `"Square POS 4.74 for Android"`).

SquareAccountDetails.description: Additional details about Square Account payments.

payment_source_token.description: Unique identifier for the payment source used for this payment.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

StandardUnitDescription.description: Contains the name and abbreviation for standard measurement unit.

unit.description: Identifies the measurement unit being described.

name.description: UI display name of the measurement unit. For example, 'Pound'.

abbreviation.description: UI display abbreviation for the measurement unit. For example, 'lb'.

standard_unit_descriptions.description: List of standard (non-custom) measurement units in this description group.

SubmitEvidenceResponse.description: Defines the fields in a `SubmitEvidence` response.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

dispute.description: The `Dispute` for which evidence was submitted.

Subscription.description:
Represents a subscription purchased by a customer.

For more information, see
[Manage Subscriptions](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/subscriptions-api/manage-subscriptions).

id.description: The Square-assigned ID of the subscription.

location_id.description: The ID of the location associated with the subscription.

plan_variation_id.description: The ID of the subscribed-to [subscription plan variation](entity:CatalogSubscriptionPlanVariation).

customer_id.description: The ID of the subscribing [customer](entity:Customer) profile.

start_date.description: The `YYYY-MM-DD`-formatted date (for example, 2013-01-15) to start the subscription.

canceled_date.description:
The `YYYY-MM-DD`-formatted date (for example, 2013-01-15) to cancel the subscription, 
when the subscription status changes to `CANCELED` and the subscription billing stops.

If this field is not set, the subscription ends according its subscription plan.

This field cannot be updated, other than being cleared.

charged_through_date.description:
The `YYYY-MM-DD`-formatted date up to when the subscriber is invoiced for the
subscription.

After the invoice is sent for a given billing period,
this date will be the last day of the billing period.
For example,
suppose for the month of May a subscriber gets an invoice
(or charged the card) on May 1. For the monthly billing scenario,
this date is then set to May 31.

status.description:
The current status of the subscription.
See [SubscriptionStatus](#type-subscriptionstatus) for possible values

tax_percentage.description:
The tax amount applied when billing the subscription. The
percentage is expressed in decimal form, using a `'.'` as the decimal
separator and without a `'%'` sign. For example, a value of `7.5`
corresponds to 7.5%.

invoice_ids.description:
The IDs of the [invoices](entity:Invoice) created for the
subscription, listed in order when the invoices were created
(newest invoices appear first).

price_override_money.description:
A custom price which overrides the cost of a subscription plan variation with `STATIC` pricing.
This field does not affect itemized subscriptions with `RELATIVE` pricing. Instead, 
you should edit the Subscription's [order template](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/subscriptions-api/manage-subscriptions#phases-and-order-templates).

version.description:
The version of the object. When updating an object, the version
supplied must match the version in the database, otherwise the write will
be rejected as conflicting.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the subscription was created, in RFC 3339 format.

card_id.description:
The ID of the [subscriber's](entity:Customer) [card](entity:Card)
used to charge for the subscription.

timezone.description:
Timezone that will be used in date calculations for the subscription.
Defaults to the timezone of the location based on `location_id`.
Format: the IANA Timezone Database identifier for the location timezone (for example, `America/Los_Angeles`).

source.description: The origination details of the subscription.

actions.description:
The list of scheduled actions on this subscription. It is set only in the response from  
[RetrieveSubscription](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-RetrieveSubscription) with the query parameter
of `include=actions` or from 
[SearchSubscriptions](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SearchSubscriptions) with the input parameter 
of `include:["actions"]`.

monthly_billing_anchor_date.description: The day of the month on which the subscription will issue invoices and publish orders.

phases.description: array of phases for this subscription

SubscriptionAction.description: Represents an action as a pending change to a subscription.

id.description: The ID of an action scoped to a subscription.

type.description:
The type of the action.
See [SubscriptionActionType](#type-subscriptionactiontype) for possible values

effective_date.description: The `YYYY-MM-DD`-formatted date when the action occurs on the subscription.

monthly_billing_anchor_date.description: The new billing anchor day value, for a `CHANGE_BILLING_ANCHOR_DATE` action.

phases.description: A list of Phases, to pass phase-specific information used in the swap.

new_plan_variation_id.description: The target subscription plan variation that a subscription switches to, for a `SWAP_PLAN` action.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCEL
x-enum-elements.description: The action to execute a scheduled cancellation of a subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: PAUSE
x-enum-elements.description: The action to execute a scheduled pause of a subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: RESUME
x-enum-elements.description: The action to execute a scheduled resumption of a subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: SWAP_PLAN
x-enum-elements.description: The action to execute a scheduled swap of a subscription plan in a subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: CHANGE_BILLING_ANCHOR_DATE
x-enum-elements.description: A billing anchor date change action.

SubscriptionActionType.description: Supported types of an action as a pending change to a subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: DAILY
x-enum-elements.description: Once per day

x-enum-elements.name: WEEKLY
x-enum-elements.description: Once per week

x-enum-elements.name: EVERY_TWO_WEEKS
x-enum-elements.description: Every two weeks

x-enum-elements.name: THIRTY_DAYS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every 30 days

x-enum-elements.name: SIXTY_DAYS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every 60 days

x-enum-elements.name: NINETY_DAYS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every 90 days

x-enum-elements.name: MONTHLY
x-enum-elements.description: Once per month

x-enum-elements.name: EVERY_TWO_MONTHS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every two months

x-enum-elements.name: QUARTERLY
x-enum-elements.description: Once every three months

x-enum-elements.name: EVERY_FOUR_MONTHS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every four months

x-enum-elements.name: EVERY_SIX_MONTHS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every six months

x-enum-elements.name: ANNUAL
x-enum-elements.description: Once per year

x-enum-elements.name: EVERY_TWO_YEARS
x-enum-elements.description: Once every two years

SubscriptionCadence.description: Determines the billing cadence of a [Subscription](entity:Subscription)

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"subscription.created"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected object’s type, `"subscription"`.

id.description: ID of the affected subscription.

object.description: An object containing the created subscription.

SubscriptionEvent.description: Describes changes to a subscription and the subscription status.

id.description: The ID of the subscription event.

subscription_event_type.description:
Type of the subscription event.
See [SubscriptionEventSubscriptionEventType](#type-subscriptioneventsubscriptioneventtype) for possible values

effective_date.description: The `YYYY-MM-DD`-formatted date (for example, 2013-01-15) when the subscription event occurred.

monthly_billing_anchor_date.description: The day-of-the-month the billing anchor date was changed to, if applicable.

info.description: Additional information about the subscription event.

phases.description: A list of Phases, to pass phase-specific information used in the swap.

plan_variation_id.description: The ID of the subscription plan variation associated with the subscription.

SubscriptionEventInfo.description: Provides information about the subscription event.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation for the event.

code.description:
An info code indicating the subscription event that occurred.
See [InfoCode](#type-infocode) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: LOCATION_NOT_ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The location is not active.

x-enum-elements.name: LOCATION_CANNOT_ACCEPT_PAYMENT

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_NO_EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description: The subscribing customer does not have an email.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_NO_NAME
x-enum-elements.description: The subscribing customer does not have a name.

x-enum-elements.name: USER_PROVIDED
x-enum-elements.description: User-provided detail.
