SubscriptionEventSubscriptionEventType.description: Supported types of an event occurred to a subscription.

SubscriptionPhase.description: Describes a phase in a subscription plan variation. For more information, see [Subscription Plans and Variations](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/subscriptions-api/plans-and-variations).

uid.description: The Square-assigned ID of the subscription phase. This field cannot be changed after a `SubscriptionPhase` is created.

cadence.description:
The billing cadence of the phase. For example, weekly or monthly. This field cannot be changed after a `SubscriptionPhase` is created.
See [SubscriptionCadence](#type-subscriptioncadence) for possible values

periods.description: The number of `cadence`s the phase lasts. If not set, the phase never ends. Only the last phase can be indefinite. This field cannot be changed after a `SubscriptionPhase` is created.

recurring_price_money.description: The amount to bill for each `cadence`. Failure to specify this field results in a `MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAMETER` error at runtime.

ordinal.description: The position this phase appears in the sequence of phases defined for the plan, indexed from 0. This field cannot be changed after a `SubscriptionPhase` is created.

SubscriptionPricing.description: Describes the pricing for the subscription.

type.description:
RELATIVE or STATIC
See [SubscriptionPricingType](#type-subscriptionpricingtype) for possible values

discount_ids.description: The ids of the discount catalog objects

price_money.description: The price of the subscription, if STATIC

x-enum-elements.name: STATIC
x-enum-elements.description: Static pricing

x-enum-elements.name: RELATIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Relative pricing

SubscriptionSource.description: The origination details of the subscription.

name.description:
The name used to identify the place (physical or digital) that
a subscription originates. If unset, the name defaults to the name
of the application that created the subscription.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription is pending to start in the future.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription is active.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription is canceled.

x-enum-elements.name: DEACTIVATED
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription is deactivated.

x-enum-elements.name: PAUSED
x-enum-elements.description: The subscription is paused.

SubscriptionTestResult.description:
Represents the details of a webhook subscription, including notification URL,
event types, and signature key.

id.description: A Square-generated unique ID for the subscription test result.

status_code.description: The status code returned by the subscription notification URL.

payload.description: An object containing the payload of the test event. For example, a `payment.created` event.

created_at.description:
The timestamp of when the subscription was created, in RFC 3339 format. 
For example, "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

updated_at.description:
The timestamp of when the subscription was updated, in RFC 3339 format. For example, "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".
Because a subscription test result is unique, this field is the same as the `created_at` field.

SubscriptionUpdatedEvent.description:
Published when a [Subscription](entity:Subscription) is updated.
Typically the `subscription.status` is updated as subscriptions become active
or cancelled.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"subscription.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected object’s type, `"subscription"`.

id.description: ID of the affected subscription.

object.description: An object containing the updated subscription.

SwapPlanRequest.description:
Defines input parameters in a call to the
[SwapPlan](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SwapPlan) endpoint.

new_plan_variation_id.description:
The ID of the new subscription plan variation.

This field is required.

phases.description: A list of PhaseInputs, to pass phase-specific information used in the swap.

SwapPlanResponse.description:
Defines output parameters in a response of the 
[SwapPlan](api-endpoint:Subscriptions-SwapPlan) endpoint.

errors.description: Errors encountered during the request.

subscription.description: The subscription with the updated subscription plan.

actions.description: A list of a `SWAP_PLAN` action created by the request.

x-enum-elements.name: TAX_SUBTOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description: The fee is calculated based on the payment's subtotal.

x-enum-elements.name: TAX_TOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description: The fee is calculated based on the payment's total.

TaxCalculationPhase.description: When to calculate the taxes due on a cart.

TaxIds.description: Identifiers for the location used by various governments for tax purposes.

eu_vat.description:
The EU VAT number for this location. For example, `IE3426675K`.
If the EU VAT number is present, it is well-formed and has been
validated with VIES, the VAT Information Exchange System.

fr_siret.description:
The SIRET (Système d'Identification du Répertoire des Entreprises et de leurs Etablissements)
number is a 14-digit code issued by the French INSEE. For example, `39922799000021`.

fr_naf.description:
The French government uses the NAF (Nomenclature des Activités Françaises) to display and
track economic statistical data. This is also called the APE (Activite Principale de l’Entreprise) code.
For example, `6910Z`.

es_nif.description:
The NIF (Numero de Identificacion Fiscal) number is a nine-character tax identifier used in Spain.
If it is present, it has been validated. For example, `73628495A`.

jp_qii.description:
The QII (Qualified Invoice Issuer) number is a 14-character tax identifier used in Japan.
For example, `T1234567890123`.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the
CatalogItemVariation price. For example, a $1.00 item with a 10% additive
tax would have a total cost to the buyer of $1.10.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an inclusive tax. The tax amount is included in the
CatalogItemVariation price. For example, a $1.00 item with a 10% inclusive
tax would have a total cost to the buyer of $1.00, with $0.91 (91 cents) of
that total being the cost of the item and $0.09 (9 cents) being tax.

TaxInclusionType.description: Whether to the tax amount should be additional to or included in the CatalogItem price.

TeamMember.description: A record representing an individual team member for a business.

id.description: The unique ID for the team member.

reference_id.description: A second ID used to associate the team member with an entity in another system.

is_owner.description: Whether the team member is the owner of the Square account.

status.description:
Describes the status of the team member.
See [TeamMemberStatus](#type-teammemberstatus) for possible values

given_name.description: The given name (that is, the first name) associated with the team member.

family_name.description: The family name (that is, the last name) associated with the team member.

email_address.description:
The email address associated with the team member. After accepting the invitation
from Square, only the team member can change this value.

phone_number.description:
The team member's phone number, in E.164 format. For example:
+14155552671 - the country code is 1 for US
+551155256325 - the country code is 55 for BR

created_at.description: The timestamp when the team member was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the team member was last updated, in RFC 3339 format.

assigned_locations.description: Describes the team member's assigned locations.

wage_setting.description: Information about the team member's overtime exemption status, job assignments, and compensation.

TeamMemberAssignedLocations.description: An object that represents a team member's assignment to locations.

assignment_type.description:
The current assignment type of the team member.
See [TeamMemberAssignedLocationsAssignmentType](#type-teammemberassignedlocationsassignmenttype) for possible values

location_ids.description: The explicit locations that the team member is assigned to.

x-enum-elements.name: ALL_CURRENT_AND_FUTURE_LOCATIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The team member is assigned to all current and future locations. The `location_ids` field
is empty if the team member has this assignment type.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPLICIT_LOCATIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The team member is assigned to an explicit subset of locations. The `location_ids` field
is the list of locations that the team member is assigned to.

TeamMemberAssignedLocationsAssignmentTyp.description: Enumerates the possible assignment types that the team member can have.

TeamMemberBookingProfile.description: The booking profile of a seller's team member, including the team member's ID, display name, description and whether the team member can be booked as a service provider.

team_member_id.description: The ID of the [TeamMember](entity:TeamMember) object for the team member associated with the booking profile.

description.description: The description of the team member.

display_name.description: The display name of the team member.

is_bookable.description: Indicates whether the team member can be booked through the Bookings API or the seller's online booking channel or site (`true`) or not (`false`).

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the team member's image for the bookings profile.

TeamMemberCreatedEvent.description: Published when a Team Member is created.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"team_member.created"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected object’s type, `"team_member"`.

id.description: ID of the created team member.

object.description: An object containing the created team member.

x-enum-elements.name: UNINVITED
x-enum-elements.description: The team member has not received an invitation.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The team member has received an invitation, but had not accepted it.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCEPTED
x-enum-elements.description: The team member has both received and accepted an invitation.

TeamMemberInvitationStatus.description: Enumerates the possible invitation statuses the team member can have within a business.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The team member can sign in to Point of Sale and the Seller Dashboard.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The team member can no longer sign in to Point of Sale or the Seller Dashboard,
but the team member's sales reports remain available.

TeamMemberStatus.description: Enumerates the possible statuses the team member can have within a business.

TeamMemberUpdatedEvent.description: Published when a Team Member is updated.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"team_member.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected object’s type, `"team_member"`.

id.description: ID of the affected team member.

object.description: An object containing the updated team member.

TeamMemberWage.description:
Job and wage information for a [team member](entity:TeamMember).
This convenience object provides details needed to specify the `wage`
field for a [timecard](entity:Timecard).

id.description: The UUID for this object.

team_member_id.description: The `TeamMember` that this wage is assigned to.

title.description: The job title that this wage relates to.

hourly_rate.description:
Can be a custom-set hourly wage or the calculated effective hourly
wage based on the annual wage and hours worked per week.

job_id.description: An identifier for the [job](entity:Job) that this wage relates to.

tip_eligible.description: Whether team members are eligible for tips when working this job.

TeamMemberWageSettingUpdatedEvent.description: Published when a Wage Setting is updated.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"team_member.wage_setting.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the event was created, in RFC 3339 format.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the affected object’s type, `"wage_setting"`.

id.description: ID of the updated team member wage setting.

object.description: An object containing the updated team member wage setting.

wage_setting.description: The updated team member wage setting.

Tender.description: Represents a tender (i.e., a method of payment) used in a Square transaction.

id.description: The tender's unique ID. It is the associated payment ID.

location_id.description: The ID of the transaction's associated location.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the tender's associated transaction.

created_at.description: The timestamp for when the tender was created, in RFC 3339 format.

note.description: An optional note associated with the tender at the time of payment.

amount_money.description:
The total amount of the tender, including `tip_money`. If the tender has a `payment_id`,
the `total_money` of the corresponding [Payment](entity:Payment) will be equal to the
`amount_money` of the tender.

tip_money.description: The tip's amount of the tender.

processing_fee_money.description:
The amount of any Square processing fees applied to the tender.

This field is not immediately populated when a new transaction is created.
It is usually available after about ten seconds.

customer_id.description:
If the tender is associated with a customer or represents a customer's card on file,
this is the ID of the associated customer.

type.description:
The type of tender, such as `CARD` or `CASH`.
See [TenderType](#type-tendertype) for possible values

card_details.description:
The details of the card tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `CARD`.

cash_details.description:
The details of the cash tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `CASH`.

bank_account_details.description:
The details of the bank account tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `BANK_ACCOUNT`.

buy_now_pay_later_details.description:
The details of a Buy Now Pay Later tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `BUY_NOW_PAY_LATER`.

square_account_details.description:
The details of a Square Account tender.

This value is present only if the value of `type` is `SQUARE_ACCOUNT`.

additional_recipients.description:
Additional recipients (other than the merchant) receiving a portion of this tender.
For example, fees assessed on the purchase by a third party integration.

payment_id.description:
The ID of the [Payment](entity:Payment) that corresponds to this tender.
This value is only present for payments created with the v2 Payments API.

TenderBankAccountDetails.description:
Represents the details of a tender with `type` `BANK_ACCOUNT`.

See [BankAccountPaymentDetails](entity:BankAccountPaymentDetails)
for more exposed details of a bank account payment.

status.description:
The bank account payment's current state.

See [TenderBankAccountPaymentDetailsStatus](entity:TenderBankAccountDetailsStatus) for possible values.
See [TenderBankAccountDetailsStatus](#type-tenderbankaccountdetailsstatus) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The bank account payment is in progress.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: The bank account payment has been completed.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The bank account payment failed.

TenderBankAccountDetailsStatus.description: Indicates the bank account payment's current status.

TenderBuyNowPayLaterDetails.description: Represents the details of a tender with `type` `BUY_NOW_PAY_LATER`.

buy_now_pay_later_brand.description:
The Buy Now Pay Later brand.
See [Brand](#type-brand) for possible values

status.description:
The buy now pay later payment's current state (such as `AUTHORIZED` or
`CAPTURED`). See [TenderBuyNowPayLaterDetailsStatus](entity:TenderBuyNowPayLaterDetailsStatus)
for possible values.
See [Status](#type-status) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZED
x-enum-elements.description: The buy now pay later payment has been authorized but not yet captured.

x-enum-elements.name: CAPTURED
x-enum-elements.description: The buy now pay later payment was authorized and subsequently captured (i.e., completed).

x-enum-elements.name: VOIDED
x-enum-elements.description: The buy now pay later payment was authorized and subsequently voided (i.e., canceled).

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The buy now pay later payment failed.

TenderCardDetails.description: Represents additional details of a tender with `type` `CARD` or `SQUARE_GIFT_CARD`

status.description:
The credit card payment's current state (such as `AUTHORIZED` or
`CAPTURED`). See [TenderCardDetailsStatus](entity:TenderCardDetailsStatus)
for possible values.
See [TenderCardDetailsStatus](#type-tendercarddetailsstatus) for possible values

entry_method.description:
The method used to enter the card's details for the transaction.
See [TenderCardDetailsEntryMethod](#type-tendercarddetailsentrymethod) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: SWIPED
x-enum-elements.description: The card was swiped through a Square reader or Square stand.

x-enum-elements.name: KEYED
x-enum-elements.description:
The card information was keyed manually into Square Point of Sale or a
Square-hosted web form.

x-enum-elements.name: EMV
x-enum-elements.description: The card was processed via EMV with a Square reader.

x-enum-elements.name: ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description: The buyer's card details were already on file with Square.

x-enum-elements.name: CONTACTLESS
x-enum-elements.description:
The card was processed via a contactless (i.e., NFC) transaction
with a Square reader.

TenderCardDetailsEntryMethod.description: Indicates the method used to enter the card's details.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZED
x-enum-elements.description: The card transaction has been authorized but not yet captured.

x-enum-elements.name: CAPTURED
x-enum-elements.description: The card transaction was authorized and subsequently captured (i.e., completed).

x-enum-elements.name: VOIDED
x-enum-elements.description: The card transaction was authorized and subsequently voided (i.e., canceled).

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The card transaction failed.

TenderCardDetailsStatus.description: Indicates the card transaction's current status.

TenderCashDetails.description: Represents the details of a tender with `type` `CASH`.

buyer_tendered_money.description: The total amount of cash provided by the buyer, before change is given.

change_back_money.description: The amount of change returned to the buyer.

TenderSquareAccountDetails.description: Represents the details of a tender with `type` `SQUARE_ACCOUNT`.

status.description:
The Square Account payment's current state (such as `AUTHORIZED` or
`CAPTURED`). See [TenderSquareAccountDetailsStatus](entity:TenderSquareAccountDetailsStatus)
for possible values.
See [Status](#type-status) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZED
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Account payment has been authorized but not yet captured.

x-enum-elements.name: CAPTURED
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Account payment was authorized and subsequently captured (i.e., completed).

x-enum-elements.name: VOIDED
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Account payment was authorized and subsequently voided (i.e., canceled).

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Account payment failed.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD
x-enum-elements.description: A credit card.

x-enum-elements.name: CASH
x-enum-elements.description: Cash.

x-enum-elements.name: THIRD_PARTY_CARD
x-enum-elements.description:
A credit card processed with a card processor other than Square.

This value applies only to merchants in countries where Square does not
yet provide card processing.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE_GIFT_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: A Square gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_SALE
x-enum-elements.description: This tender represents the register being opened for a "no sale" event.

x-enum-elements.name: BANK_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: A bank account payment.

x-enum-elements.name: WALLET
x-enum-elements.description:
A payment from a digital wallet, e.g. Cash App, Paypay, Rakuten Pay,
Au Pay, D Barai, Merpay, Wechat Pay, Alipay.

Note: Some "digital wallets", including Google Pay and Apple Pay, facilitate
card payments.  Those payments have the `CARD` type.

x-enum-elements.name: BUY_NOW_PAY_LATER
x-enum-elements.description: A Buy Now Pay Later payment.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: A Square House Account payment.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description: A form of tender that does not match any other value.

TerminalAction.description: Represents an action processed by the Square Terminal.

id.description: A unique ID for this `TerminalAction`.

device_id.description:
The unique Id of the device intended for this `TerminalAction`.
The Id can be retrieved from /v2/devices api.

deadline_duration.description:
The duration as an RFC 3339 duration, after which the action will be automatically canceled.
TerminalActions that are `PENDING` will be automatically `CANCELED` and have a cancellation reason
of `TIMED_OUT`

Default: 5 minutes from creation

Maximum: 5 minutes

status.description:
The status of the `TerminalAction`.
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`

cancel_reason.description:
The reason why `TerminalAction` is canceled. Present if the status is `CANCELED`.
See [ActionCancelReason](#type-actioncancelreason) for possible values

created_at.description: The time when the `TerminalAction` was created as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

updated_at.description: The time when the `TerminalAction` was last updated as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

app_id.description: The ID of the application that created the action.

location_id.description: The location id the action is attached to, if a link can be made.

type.description:
Represents the type of the action.
See [ActionType](#type-actiontype) for possible values

qr_code_options.description: Describes configuration for the QR code action. Requires `QR_CODE` type.

save_card_options.description: Describes configuration for the save-card action. Requires `SAVE_CARD` type.

signature_options.description: Describes configuration for the signature capture action. Requires `SIGNATURE` type.

confirmation_options.description: Describes configuration for the confirmation action. Requires `CONFIRMATION` type.

receipt_options.description: Describes configuration for the receipt action. Requires `RECEIPT` type.

data_collection_options.description: Describes configuration for the data collection action. Requires `DATA_COLLECTION` type.

select_options.description: Describes configuration for the select action. Requires `SELECT` type.

device_metadata.description:
Details about the Terminal that received the action request (such as battery level,
operating system version, and network connection settings).

Only available for `PING` action type.

await_next_action.description:
Indicates the action will be linked to another action and requires a waiting dialog to be
displayed instead of returning to the idle screen on completion of the action.

Only supported on SIGNATURE, CONFIRMATION, DATA_COLLECTION, and SELECT types.

await_next_action_duration.description:
The timeout duration of the waiting dialog as an RFC 3339 duration, after which the
waiting dialog will no longer be displayed and the Terminal will return to the idle screen.

Default: 5 minutes from when the waiting dialog is displayed

Maximum: 5 minutes

x-enum-elements.name: QR_CODE
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to display a QR code. Details are contained in
the `qr_code_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: PING
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to check if the specific device is
online or currently active with the merchant in question. Does not require an action options value.

x-enum-elements.name: SAVE_CARD
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents a request to save a card for future card-on-file use. Details are contained
in the `save_card_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: SIGNATURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to capture a buyer's signature. Details are contained
in the `signature_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: CONFIRMATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to collect a buyer's confirmation decision to the
displayed terms. Details are contained in the `confirmation_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIPT
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to display the receipt screen options. Details are
contained in the `receipt_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: DATA_COLLECTION
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to collect a buyer's text data. Details
are contained in the `data_collection_options` object.

x-enum-elements.name: SELECT
x-enum-elements.description:
The action represents a request to allow the buyer to select from provided options.
Details are contained in the `select_options` object.

TerminalActionActionType.description: Describes the type of this unit and indicates which field contains the unit information. This is an ‘open’ enum.

TerminalActionCreatedEvent.description: Published when a TerminalAction is created.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.action.created"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the created object’s type, `"action"`.

id.description: ID of the created terminal action.

object.description: An object containing the created terminal action.

device_id.description:
`TerminalAction`s associated with a specific device. If no device is specified then all
`TerminalAction`s for the merchant will be displayed.

created_at.description:
Time range for the beginning of the reporting period. Inclusive.
Default value: The current time minus one day.
Note that `TerminalAction`s are available for 30 days after creation.

status.description:
Filter results with the desired status of the `TerminalAction`
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`

type.description:
Filter results with the requested ActionType.
See [TerminalActionActionType](#type-terminalactionactiontype) for possible values

sort_order.description:
The order in which results are listed.
- `ASC` - Oldest to newest.
- `DESC` - Newest to oldest (default).
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

TerminalActionUpdatedEvent.description: Published when a TerminalAction is updated.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.action.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the updated object’s type, `"action"`.

id.description: ID of the updated terminal action.

object.description: An object containing the updated terminal action.

TerminalCheckout.description: Represents a checkout processed by the Square Terminal.

id.description: A unique ID for this `TerminalCheckout`.

amount_money.description: The amount of money (including the tax amount) that the Square Terminal device should try to collect.

reference_id.description:
An optional user-defined reference ID that can be used to associate
this `TerminalCheckout` to another entity in an external system. For example, an order
ID generated by a third-party shopping cart. The ID is also associated with any payments
used to complete the checkout.

note.description:
An optional note to associate with the checkout, as well as with any payments used to complete the checkout.
Note: maximum 500 characters

order_id.description: The reference to the Square order ID for the checkout request.

payment_options.description: Payment-specific options for the checkout request.

device_options.description: Options to control the display and behavior of the Square Terminal device.

deadline_duration.description:
An RFC 3339 duration, after which the checkout is automatically canceled.
A `TerminalCheckout` that is `PENDING` is automatically `CANCELED` and has a cancellation reason
of `TIMED_OUT`.

Default: 5 minutes from creation

Maximum: 5 minutes

status.description:
The status of the `TerminalCheckout`.
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`

cancel_reason.description:
The reason why `TerminalCheckout` is canceled. Present if the status is `CANCELED`.
See [ActionCancelReason](#type-actioncancelreason) for possible values

payment_ids.description: A list of IDs for payments created by this `TerminalCheckout`.

created_at.description: The time when the `TerminalCheckout` was created, as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

updated_at.description: The time when the `TerminalCheckout` was last updated, as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

app_id.description: The ID of the application that created the checkout.

location_id.description: The location of the device where the `TerminalCheckout` was directed.

payment_type.description:
The type of payment the terminal should attempt to capture from. Defaults to `CARD_PRESENT`.
See [CheckoutOptionsPaymentType](#type-checkoutoptionspaymenttype) for possible values

team_member_id.description: An optional ID of the team member associated with creating the checkout.

customer_id.description: An optional ID of the customer associated with the checkout.

app_fee_money.description:
The amount the developer is taking as a fee for facilitating the payment on behalf
of the seller.

The amount cannot be more than 90% of the total amount of the payment.

The amount must be specified in the smallest denomination of the applicable currency (for example, US dollar amounts are specified in cents). For more information, see [Working with Monetary Amounts](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-monetary-amounts).

The fee currency code must match the currency associated with the seller that is accepting the payment. The application must be from a developer account in the same country and using the same currency code as the seller.

For more information about the application fee scenario, see [Take Payments and Collect Fees](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/payments-api/take-payments-and-collect-fees).

To set this field, PAYMENTS_WRITE_ADDITIONAL_RECIPIENTS OAuth permission is required. For more information, see [Permissions](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/payments-api/take-payments-and-collect-fees#permissions).

statement_description_identifier.description:
Optional additional payment information to include on the customer's card statement as
part of the statement description. This can be, for example, an invoice number, ticket number,
or short description that uniquely identifies the purchase.

tip_money.description:
The amount designated as a tip, in addition to `amount_money`. This may only be set for a
checkout that has tipping disabled (`tip_settings.allow_tipping` is `false`).

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.checkout.created"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the created object’s type, `"checkout"`.

id.description: ID of the created terminal checkout.

object.description: An object containing the created terminal checkout

device_id.description:
The `TerminalCheckout` objects associated with a specific device. If no device is specified, then all
`TerminalCheckout` objects for the merchant are displayed.

created_at.description:
The time range for the beginning of the reporting period, which is inclusive.
Default value: The current time minus one day.
Note that `TerminalCheckout`s are available for 30 days after creation.

status.description:
Filtered results with the desired status of the `TerminalCheckout`.
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`

sort_order.description:
The order in which results are listed.
Default: `DESC`
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.checkout.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the updated object’s type, `"checkout"`.

id.description: ID of the updated terminal checkout.

object.description: An object containing the updated terminal checkout

TerminalRefund.description: Represents a payment refund processed by the Square Terminal. Only supports Interac (Canadian debit network) payment refunds.

id.description: A unique ID for this `TerminalRefund`.

refund_id.description: The reference to the payment refund created by completing this `TerminalRefund`.

payment_id.description: The unique ID of the payment being refunded.

order_id.description: The reference to the Square order ID for the payment identified by the `payment_id`.

amount_money.description:
The amount of money, inclusive of `tax_money`, that the `TerminalRefund` should return.
This value is limited to the amount taken in the original payment minus any completed or
pending refunds.

reason.description: A description of the reason for the refund.

device_id.description:
The unique ID of the device intended for this `TerminalRefund`.
The Id can be retrieved from /v2/devices api.

deadline_duration.description:
The RFC 3339 duration, after which the refund is automatically canceled.
A `TerminalRefund` that is `PENDING` is automatically `CANCELED` and has a cancellation reason
of `TIMED_OUT`.

Default: 5 minutes from creation.

Maximum: 5 minutes

status.description:
The status of the `TerminalRefund`.
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, or `COMPLETED`.

cancel_reason.description:
Present if the status is `CANCELED`.
See [ActionCancelReason](#type-actioncancelreason) for possible values

created_at.description: The time when the `TerminalRefund` was created, as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

updated_at.description: The time when the `TerminalRefund` was last updated, as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

app_id.description: The ID of the application that created the refund.

location_id.description: The location of the device where the `TerminalRefund` was directed.

TerminalRefundCreatedEvent.description: Published when a Terminal API refund is created.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.refund.created"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the created object’s type, `"refund"`.

id.description: ID of the created terminal refund.

object.description: An object containing the created terminal refund.

filter.description: The filter for the Terminal refund query.

sort.description: The sort order for the Terminal refund query.

device_id.description:
`TerminalRefund` objects associated with a specific device. If no device is specified, then all
`TerminalRefund` objects for the signed-in account are displayed.

created_at.description:
The timestamp for the beginning of the reporting period, in RFC 3339 format. Inclusive.
Default value: The current time minus one day.
Note that `TerminalRefund`s are available for 30 days after creation.

status.description:
Filtered results with the desired status of the `TerminalRefund`.
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, or `COMPLETED`.

sort_order.description:
The order in which results are listed.
- `ASC` - Oldest to newest.
- `DESC` - Newest to oldest (default).

TerminalRefundUpdatedEvent.description: Published when a Terminal API refund is updated.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the target merchant associated with the event.

type.description: The type of event this represents, `"terminal.refund.updated"`.

event_id.description: A unique ID for the event.

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp of when the event was created.

data.description: Data associated with the event.

type.description: Name of the updated object’s type, `"refund"`.

id.description: ID of the updated terminal refund.

object.description: An object containing the updated terminal refund.

TestWebhookSubscriptionRequest.description: Tests a [Subscription](entity:WebhookSubscription) by sending a test event to its notification URL.

event_type.description:
The event type that will be used to test the [Subscription](entity:WebhookSubscription). The event type must be
contained in the list of event types in the [Subscription](entity:WebhookSubscription).

TestWebhookSubscriptionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [TestWebhookSubscription](api-endpoint:WebhookSubscriptions-TestWebhookSubscription) endpoint.

Note: If there are errors processing the request, the [SubscriptionTestResult](entity:SubscriptionTestResult) field is not
present.

errors.description: Information on errors encountered during the request.

TimeRange.description:
Represents a generic time range. The start and end values are
represented in RFC 3339 format. Time ranges are customized to be
inclusive or exclusive based on the needs of a particular endpoint.
Refer to the relevant endpoint-specific documentation to determine
how time ranges are handled.

start_at.description:
A datetime value in RFC 3339 format indicating when the time range
starts.

end_at.description:
A datetime value in RFC 3339 format indicating when the time range
ends.

Timecard.description:
A record of the hourly rate, start time, and end time of a single timecard (shift)
for a team member. This might include a record of the start and end times of breaks
taken during the shift.

id.description: **Read only** The Square-issued UUID for this object.

location_id.description:
The ID of the [location](entity:Location) for this timecard. The location should be based on
where the team member clocked in.

timezone.description:
**Read only** The time zone calculated from the location based on the `location_id`,
provided as a convenience value. Format: the IANA time zone database identifier for the
location time zone.

start_at.description:
The start time of the timecard, in RFC 3339 format and shifted to the location
timezone + offset. Precision up to the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

end_at.description:
The end time of the timecard, in RFC 3339 format and shifted to the location
timezone + offset. Precision up to the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

wage.description:
Job and pay related information. If the wage is not set on create, it defaults to a wage
of zero. If the title is not set on create, it defaults to the name of the role the team member
is assigned to, if any.

breaks.description: A list of all the paid or unpaid breaks that were taken during this timecard.

status.description:
Describes the working state of the timecard.
See [TimecardStatus](#type-timecardstatus) for possible values

version.description:
**Read only** The current version of the timecard, which is incremented with each update.
This field is used for [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency)
control to ensure that requests don't overwrite data from another request.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the timecard was created, in RFC 3339 format presented as UTC.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the timecard was last updated, in RFC 3339 format presented as UTC.

team_member_id.description: The ID of the [team member](entity:TeamMember) this timecard belongs to.

declared_cash_tip_money.description: The cash tips declared by the team member for this timecard.

TimecardFilter.description:
Defines a filter used in a search for `Timecard` records. `AND` logic is
used by Square's servers to apply each filter property specified.

location_ids.description: Fetch timecards for the specified location.

status.description:
Fetch a `Timecard` instance by `Timecard.status`.
See [TimecardFilterStatus](#type-timecardfilterstatus) for possible values

start.description: Fetch `Timecard` instances that start in the time range - Inclusive.

end.description: Fetch the `Timecard` instances that end in the time range - Inclusive.

workday.description: Fetch the `Timecard` instances based on the workday date range.

team_member_ids.description: Fetch timecards for the specified team members.

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: Timecards that have been started and not ended.

x-enum-elements.name: CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description: Timecards that have been started and ended.

TimecardFilterStatus.description: Specifies the `status` of `Timecard` records to be returned.

TimecardQuery.description: The parameters of a `Timecard` search query, which includes filter and sort options.

TimecardSort.description: Sets the sort order of search results.

field.description:
The field to sort on.
See [TimecardSortField](#type-timecardsortfield) for possible values

order.description:
The order in which results are returned. Defaults to DESC.
See [SortOrder](#type-sortorder) for possible values

x-enum-elements.name: START_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The start date/time of a `Timecard`

x-enum-elements.name: END_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The end date/time of a `Timecard`

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The date/time that a `Timecard` is created

x-enum-elements.name: UPDATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: The most recent date/time that a `Timecard` is updated

TimecardSortField.description: Enumerates the `Timecard` fields to sort on.

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: The timecard has a `start_at` time but no `end_at` time, indicating an ongoing shift.

x-enum-elements.name: CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The timecard has both `start_at` and `end_at` times, indicating a completed shift.

TimecardStatus.description: **Read only** Enumerates the possible status of a [timecard](entity:Timecard).

TimecardWage.description: The hourly wage rate used to compensate a team member for a [timecard](entity:Timecard).

title.description: The name of the job performed during this timecard.

hourly_rate.description:
Can be a custom-set hourly wage or the calculated effective hourly
wage based on the annual wage and hours worked per week.

job_id.description:
The ID of the [job](entity:Job) performed for this timecard. Square
labor-reporting UIs might group timecards together by ID.

tip_eligible.description: Whether team members are eligible for tips when working this job.

TimecardWorkday.description:
A `Timecard` search query filter parameter that sets a range of days that
a `Timecard` must start or end in before passing the filter condition.

match_timecards_by.description:
The strategy on which the dates are applied.
See [TimecardWorkdayMatcher](#type-timecardworkdaymatcher) for possible values

default_timezone.description:
Location-specific timezones convert workdays to datetime filters.
Every location included in the query must have a timezone or this field
must be provided as a fallback. Format: the IANA timezone database
identifier for the relevant timezone.

x-enum-elements.name: START_AT
x-enum-elements.description: All timecards that start on or after the specified workday

x-enum-elements.name: END_AT
x-enum-elements.description: All timecards that end on or before the specified workday

x-enum-elements.name: INTERSECTION
x-enum-elements.description: All timecards that start between the start and end workdays (inclusive)

TimecardWorkdayMatcher.description: Defines the logic used to apply a workday filter.

allow_tipping.description: Indicates whether tipping is enabled for this checkout. Defaults to false.

separate_tip_screen.description:
Indicates whether tip options should be presented on the screen before presenting
the signature screen during card payment. Defaults to false.

custom_tip_field.description: Indicates whether custom tip amounts are allowed during the checkout flow. Defaults to false.

tip_percentages.description:
A list of tip percentages that should be presented during the checkout flow, specified as
up to 3 non-negative integers from 0 to 100 (inclusive). Defaults to 15, 20, and 25.

smart_tipping.description:
Enables the "Smart Tip Amounts" behavior.
Exact tipping options depend on the region in which the Square seller is active.

For payments under 10.00, in the Australia, Canada, Ireland, United Kingdom, and United States, tipping options are presented as no tip, .50, 1.00 or 2.00.

For payment amounts of 10.00 or greater, tipping options are presented as the following percentages: 0%, 5%, 10%, 15%.

If set to true, the `tip_percentages` settings is ignored.
Defaults to false.

To learn more about smart tipping, see [Accept Tips with the Square App](https://squareup.com/help/us/en/article/5069-accept-tips-with-the-square-app).

Transaction.description:
Represents a transaction processed with Square, either with the
Connect API or with Square Point of Sale.

The `tenders` field of this object lists all methods of payment used to pay in
the transaction.

id.description: The transaction's unique ID, issued by Square payments servers.

location_id.description: The ID of the transaction's associated location.

created_at.description: The timestamp for when the transaction was created, in RFC 3339 format.

tenders.description: The tenders used to pay in the transaction.

refunds.description: Refunds that have been applied to any tender in the transaction.

reference_id.description:
If the transaction was created with the [Charge](api-endpoint:Transactions-Charge)
endpoint, this value is the same as the value provided for the `reference_id`
parameter in the request to that endpoint. Otherwise, it is not set.

product.description:
The Square product that processed the transaction.
See [TransactionProduct](#type-transactionproduct) for possible values

client_id.description:
If the transaction was created in the Square Point of Sale app, this value
is the ID generated for the transaction by Square Point of Sale.

This ID has no relationship to the transaction's canonical `id`, which is
generated by Square's backend servers. This value is generated for bookkeeping
purposes, in case the transaction cannot immediately be completed (for example,
if the transaction is processed in offline mode).

It is not currently possible with the Connect API to perform a transaction
lookup by this value.

shipping_address.description: The shipping address provided in the request, if any.

order_id.description: The order_id is an identifier for the order associated with this transaction, if any.

x-enum-elements.name: REGISTER
x-enum-elements.description: Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: EXTERNAL_API
x-enum-elements.description: The Square Connect API.

x-enum-elements.name: BILLING
x-enum-elements.description: A Square subscription for one of multiple products.

x-enum-elements.name: APPOINTMENTS
x-enum-elements.description: Square Appointments.

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICES
x-enum-elements.description: Square Invoices.

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_STORE
x-enum-elements.description: Square Online Store.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYROLL
x-enum-elements.description: Square Payroll.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description: A Square product that does not match any other value.

TransactionProduct.description: Indicates the Square product used to process a transaction.

TransactionType.description: The transaction type used in the disputed payment.

UnlinkCustomerFromGiftCardRequest.description: A request to unlink a customer from a gift card.

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer to unlink from the gift card.

UnlinkCustomerFromGiftCardResponse.description:
A response that contains the unlinked `GiftCard` object. If the request resulted in errors, 
the response contains a set of `Error` objects.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

gift_card.description:
The gift card with the ID of the unlinked customer removed from the `customer_ids` field. 
If no other customers are linked, the `customer_ids` field is also removed.

custom_attribute_definition.description:
The custom attribute definition that contains the fields to update. Only the following fields can be updated:
- `name`
- `description`
- `visibility`
- `schema` for a `Selection` data type. Only changes to the named options or the maximum number of allowed
selections are supported.

For more information, see
[Updatable definition fields](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/booking-custom-attributes-api/custom-attribute-definitions#updatable-definition-fields).

To enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency)
control, include the optional `version` field and specify the current version of the custom attribute definition.

idempotency_key.description:
A unique identifier for this request, used to ensure idempotency. For more information,
see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

UpdateBookingCustomAttributeDefinitionRe.description:
Represents an [UpdateBookingCustomAttributeDefinition](api-endpoint:BookingCustomAttributes-UpdateBookingCustomAttributeDefinition) response.
Either `custom_attribute_definition` or `errors` is present in the response.

custom_attribute_definition.description: The updated custom attribute definition.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

custom_attribute_definition.description: Update the description as desired.
custom_attribute_definition.name: Favorite shampoo

idempotency_key.description: A unique key to make this request an idempotent operation.

booking.description: The booking to be updated. Individual attributes explicitly specified here override the corresponding values of the existing booking.

errors.description: Errors that occurred during the request.

booking.customer_note: I would like to sit near the window please

UpdateBreakTypeResponse.description:
A response to a request to update a `BreakType`. The response contains
the requested `BreakType` objects and might contain a set of `Error` objects if
the request resulted in errors.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

idempotency_key.description:
A unique string that identifies this UpdateCatalogImage request.
Keys can be any valid string but must be unique for every UpdateCatalogImage request.

See [Idempotency keys](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency) for more information.

image_data.caption: A picture of a cup of coffee
image_data.name: Coffee

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

image.description:
The newly updated `CatalogImage` including a Square-generated
URL for the encapsulated image file.

image_data.caption: A picture of a cup of coffee
image_data.name: Coffee

custom_attribute_definition.description:
The custom attribute definition that contains the fields to update. This endpoint
supports sparse updates, so only new or changed fields need to be included in the request.
Only the following fields can be updated:

- `name`
- `description`
- `visibility`
- `schema` for a `Selection` data type. Only changes to the named options or the maximum number of allowed
selections are supported.

For more information, see
[Updatable definition fields](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customer-custom-attributes-api/custom-attribute-definitions#updatable-definition-fields).

To enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency) 
control, include the optional `version` field and specify the current version of the custom attribute definition.

idempotency_key.description:
A unique identifier for this request, used to ensure idempotency. For more information,
see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

custom_attribute_definition.description: Update the description as desired.

UpdateCustomerCustomAttributeDefinitionR.description:
Represents an [UpdateCustomerCustomAttributeDefinition](api-endpoint:CustomerCustomAttributes-UpdateCustomerCustomAttributeDefinition) response.
Either `custom_attribute_definition` or `errors` is present in the response.

custom_attribute_definition.description: The updated custom attribute definition.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

custom_attribute_definition.description: Update the description as desired.
custom_attribute_definition.name: Favorite Movie

UpdateCustomerGroupRequest.description:
Defines the body parameters that can be included in a request to the
[UpdateCustomerGroup](api-endpoint:CustomerGroups-UpdateCustomerGroup) endpoint.

group.description: The `CustomerGroup` object including all the updates you want to make.

UpdateCustomerGroupResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [UpdateCustomerGroup](api-endpoint:CustomerGroups-UpdateCustomerGroup) endpoint.

Either `errors` or `group` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

UpdateCustomerRequest.description:
Defines the body parameters that can be included in a request to the
`UpdateCustomer` endpoint.

given_name.description:
The given name (that is, the first name) associated with the customer profile.

The maximum length for this value is 300 characters.

family_name.description:
The family name (that is, the last name) associated with the customer profile.

The maximum length for this value is 300 characters.

company_name.description:
A business name associated with the customer profile.

The maximum length for this value is 500 characters.

nickname.description:
A nickname for the customer profile.

The maximum length for this value is 100 characters.

email_address.description:
The email address associated with the customer profile.

The maximum length for this value is 254 characters.

address.description:
The physical address associated with the customer profile. Only new or changed fields are required in the request.

For maximum length constraints, see [Customer addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/keep-records#address).
The `first_name` and `last_name` fields are ignored if they are present in the request.

phone_number.description:
The phone number associated with the customer profile. The phone number must be valid and can contain
9–16 digits, with an optional `+` prefix and country code. For more information, see
[Customer phone numbers](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/keep-records#phone-number).

reference_id.description:
An optional second ID used to associate the customer profile with an
entity in another system.

The maximum length for this value is 100 characters.

note.description: A custom note associated with the customer profile.

birthday.description:
The birthday associated with the customer profile, in `YYYY-MM-DD` or `MM-DD` format. For example,
specify `1998-09-21` for September 21, 1998, or `09-21` for September 21. Birthdays are returned in `YYYY-MM-DD`
format, where `YYYY` is the specified birth year or `0000` if a birth year is not specified.

version.description:
The current version of the customer profile.

As a best practice, you should include this field to enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency) control. For more information, see [Update a customer profile](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/use-the-api/keep-records#update-a-customer-profile).

tax_ids.description:
The tax ID associated with the customer profile. This field is available only for customers of sellers
in EU countries or the United Kingdom. For more information,
see [Customer tax IDs](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/what-it-does#customer-tax-ids).

UpdateCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the [UpdateCustomer](api-endpoint:Customers-UpdateCustomer) or
[BulkUpdateCustomers](api-endpoint:Customers-BulkUpdateCustomers) endpoint.

Either `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

invoice.description:
The invoice fields to add, change, or clear. Fields can be cleared using
null values or the `remove` field (for individual payment requests or reminders).
The current invoice `version` is also required. For more information, including requirements,
limitations, and more examples, see [Update an Invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/update-invoices).

idempotency_key.description:
A unique string that identifies the `UpdateInvoice` request. If you do not
provide `idempotency_key` (or provide an empty string as the value), the endpoint
treats each request as independent.

For more information, see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

fields_to_clear.description:
The list of fields to clear. Although this field is currently supported, we
recommend using null values or the `remove` field when possible. For examples, see
[Update an Invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/update-invoices).

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

item_ids.description: The IDs of the catalog items associated with the CatalogModifierList objects being updated.

modifier_lists_to_enable.description:
The IDs of the CatalogModifierList objects to enable for the CatalogItem.
At least one of `modifier_lists_to_enable` or `modifier_lists_to_disable` must be specified.

modifier_lists_to_disable.description:
The IDs of the CatalogModifierList objects to disable for the CatalogItem.
At least one of `modifier_lists_to_enable` or `modifier_lists_to_disable` must be specified.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-data-types/working-with-dates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., `2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z`.

item_ids.description:
IDs for the CatalogItems associated with the CatalogTax objects being updated.
No more than 1,000 IDs may be provided.

taxes_to_enable.description:
IDs of the CatalogTax objects to enable.
At least one of `taxes_to_enable` or `taxes_to_disable` must be specified.

taxes_to_disable.description:
IDs of the CatalogTax objects to disable.
At least one of `taxes_to_enable` or `taxes_to_disable` must be specified.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., `2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z`.

job.description:
The job with the updated fields, either `title`, `is_tip_eligible`, or both. Only changed fields need
to be included in the request. Optionally include `version` to enable optimistic concurrency control.

Represents an [UpdateJob](api-endpoint:Team-UpdateJob) response. Either `job` or `errors`
is present in the response.

errors.description: The errors that occurred during the request.

custom_attribute_definition.description:
The custom attribute definition that contains the fields to update. This endpoint
supports sparse updates, so only new or changed fields need to be included in the request.
Only the following fields can be updated:
- `name`
- `description`
- `visibility`
- `schema` for a `Selection` data type. Only changes to the named options or the maximum number of allowed
selections are supported.

For more information, see
[Update a location custom attribute definition](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/location-custom-attributes-api/custom-attribute-definitions#update-custom-attribute-definition).
To enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency)
control, specify the current version of the custom attribute definition. 
If this is not important for your application, `version` can be set to -1.

idempotency_key.description:
A unique identifier for this request, used to ensure idempotency. For more information,
see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

custom_attribute_definition.description: Update the description as desired.

Defines the fields that are included in requests to the
[UpdateOrder](api-endpoint:Orders-UpdateOrder) endpoint.

order.description:
The [sparse order](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/manage-orders/update-orders#sparse-order-objects)
containing only the fields to update and the version to which the update is
being applied.

fields_to_clear.description:
The [dot notation paths](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/manage-orders/update-orders#identifying-fields-to-delete)
fields to clear. For example, `line_items[uid].note`.
For more information, see [Deleting fields](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/manage-orders/update-orders#deleting-fields).

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this update request.

If you are unsure whether a particular update was applied to an order successfully,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about creating duplicate updates to the order.
The latest order version is returned.

For more information, see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred when updating the payment link.

UpdatePaymentRequest.description:
Describes a request to update a payment using
[UpdatePayment](api-endpoint:Payments-UpdatePayment).

idempotency_key.description:
A unique string that identifies this `UpdatePayment` request. Keys can be any valid string
but must be unique for every `UpdatePayment` request.

For more information, see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

scheduled_shift.description:
The scheduled shift with any updates in the `draft_shift_details` field.
If needed, call [ListLocations](api-endpoint:Locations-ListLocations) to get location IDs,
[ListJobs](api-endpoint:Team-ListJobs) to get job IDs, and [SearchTeamMembers](api-endpoint:Team-SearchTeamMembers)
to get team member IDs and current job assignments. Updates made to `published_shift_details`
are ignored.

If provided, the `start_at` and `end_at` timestamps must be in the time zone + offset of the
shift location specified in `location_id`. Example for Pacific Standard Time: 2024-10-31T12:30:00-08:00

To enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency)
control for the request, provide the current version of the shift in the `version` field.
If the provided version doesn't match the server version, the request fails. If `version` is
omitted, Square executes a blind write, potentially overwriting data from another publish request.

these are cents, in JPY they are Yen (which do not have a 'cent' concept).

id.description: The order's unique identifier.
